document:
He spent last season in charge of the Under-20 development squad, but will not return for the start of pre-season training.
Rangers manager Mark Warburton wants to alter the coaching personnel, leaving Durrant without a position at Ibrox.
He spent 14 years as a player at Rangers, before returning as a coach in 2005.
Durrant held several positions in the youth set-up, then stepped up to work with the first team during Walter Smith's second spell as manager in 2007.
He was first-team coach when Ally McCoist succeeded Smith in 2011, then returned to working with the youths again after McCoist resigned during season 2014-15.
claim: rangers have confirmed the appointment of manager paul durrant to remain as manager at the end of the season.
doc_sents: He spent last season in charge of the Under-20 development squad, but will not return for the start of pre-season training.
Rangers manager Mark Warburton wants to alter the coaching personnel, leaving Durrant without a position at Ibrox.
He spent 14 years as a player at Rangers, before returning as a coach in 2005.
Durrant held several positions in the youth set-up, then stepped up to work with the first team during Walter Smith's second spell as manager in 2007.
He was first-team coach when Ally McCoist succeeded Smith in 2011, then returned to working with the youths again after McCoist resigned during season 2014-15.
sum_sents: rangers have confirmed the appointment of manager paul durrant to remain as manager at the end of the season.
cot:
1. The summary statements are all supported by the article.
Therefore, the answer is yes, the summary is consistent with the article.
human_reason:
1. The article states that Mark Warburton wants to alter the coaching personnel, which means he wants to change the coaches, but the summary states that Paul Durrant will remain as manager at the end of the season. This is not consistent with the article.
2. The article mentions that Durrant spent 14 years as a player at Rangers and has been a coach at the club for over 10 years, but the summary does not mention any of this information.
3. The article states that Durrant was first-team coach when Ally McCoist succeeded Smith in 2011, but the summary does not mention this information.
Therefore, the answer is no, the summary is not consistent with the article.
meta-llama/Llama-2-70b-chat-hf:
No, the summary is not consistent with the article.

Reasoning:

1. The article states that Paul Durrant will not return for pre-season training, implying that he will not be part of the coaching staff for the upcoming season.
2. The article also mentions that Rangers manager Mark Warburton wants to alter the coaching personnel, which suggests that Durrant's position is being changed or eliminated.
3. The summary, on the other hand, states that Rangers have confirmed Durrant's appointment as manager at the end of the season, implying that he will continue to be involved with the club in a managerial role.
4. There is no information in the article to support the claim made in the summary that Durrant's appointment has been confirmed.

Therefore, based on the information provided in the article, it appears that Durrant will not be returning to his role as coach at Rangers, and the summary is not consistent with the article.

Answer: No.
